intro: Hibbertia patens, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically shrub-like in growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy areas. Hibbertia patens is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
